par.text: Mendelevium is a synthetic, radioactive metal (a transuranic element), belonging to the actinide series. Its most stable isotope is mendelevium-258 with a half-life of 56 days. Mendelevium usually exhibits a valency of 3 in its compounds, such as mendelevium(III) chloride - MdC

. Mendelevium was discovered in 1955 at the University of California in Berkeley by Albert Ghiorso, Bernard G. Harvey, Gregory R. Choppin, Stanley G. Thompson and Glenn T. Seaborg. The element was named in honour of the Russian chemist, Dmitri Mendeleyev, the author of the periodic table of the elements.
